repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: @justinmk @zeertzjq as promised, here's the stuff left over from our discussion in #28515.

comment_data.body: Add a comment about the difference of this function with `os_homedir()`?
Or maybe one of these functions should be renamed, as it's confusing to have both `os_homedir()` and `os_get_homedir()`.
You mean describe the differences in the commit message?
Sorry, I mean add a comment above this function.

does it make sense to rename the existing `os_homedir` to `uv_homedir` (and keep it private/static), then name this new function `os_homedir` ? And the docstring on the new function can mention:

    /// Gets the "real", resolved user home directory. See comment on `homedir`.

this it() can live in the describe() block starting on line 17. Else this is missing before_all(...).

```suggestion
    it('expands ~/ on Windows', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -194,3 +194,41 @@ describe('command-line option', function()
     matches('Compilation: .*Run :checkhealth', fn.system({ nvim_prog_abs(), '-V1', '-v' }))
   end)
 end)
+
+if is_os('win') then
+  describe('Windows features', function()
+    it('expands ~/', function()

comment_data.body: test looks very redundant, can the code be deduplicated
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -194,3 +194,41 @@ describe('command-line option', function()
     matches('Compilation: .*Run :checkhealth', fn.system({ nvim_prog_abs(), '-V1', '-v' }))
   end)
 end)
+
+if is_os('win') then
+  describe('Windows features', function()
+    it('expands ~/', function()
+      local fname = os.getenv('USERPROFILE') .. '\\nvim_test.txt'
+      os.remove(fname)
+      write_file(fname, 'some text')
+      eq(
+        'some text',
+        fn.system({
+          nvim_prog_abs(),
+          '-es',
+          '+%print',
+          '+q',
+          '~/nvim_test.txt'
+        }):gsub('\n', '')
+      )
+      os.remove(fname)
+    end)
+
+    it('expands ~\\', function()

comment_data.body: `uv_` prefix is for libuv functions. This is a wrapper around a libuv function, so I think it should at least be `os_uv_homedir`.

I think you should reference the comment above the `homedir` variable.
> ```
> /// Gets the "real", resolved user home directory. See comment on `homedir`.
> ```

I don't think it's necessary to use `os.remove()` before writing to the file. However, it's better to use it in `finally()`, so that the file is deleted even if the test fails.
```suggestion
        finally(function()
          os.remove(fname)
        end)
        write_file(fname, 'some text')
        eq(
          'some text',
          fn.system({
            nvim_prog_abs(),
            '-es',
            '+%print',
            '+q',
            prefix .. 'nvim_test.txt',
          }):gsub('\n', '')
        )
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -193,4 +193,25 @@ describe('command-line option', function()
     matches('Run "nvim %-V1 %-v"', fn.system({ nvim_prog_abs(), '-v' }))
     matches('Compilation: .*Run :checkhealth', fn.system({ nvim_prog_abs(), '-V1', '-v' }))
   end)
+
+  if is_os('win') then
+    for _, prefix in ipairs({ '~/', '~\\' }) do
+      it('expands ' .. prefix .. ' on Windows', function()
+        local fname = os.getenv('USERPROFILE') .. '\\nvim_test.txt'
+        os.remove(fname)
+        write_file(fname, 'some text')
+        eq(
+          'some text',
+          fn.system({
+            nvim_prog_abs(),
+            '-es',
+            '+%print',
+            '+q',
+            prefix .. 'nvim_test.txt',
+          }):gsub('\n', '')
+        )
+        os.remove(fname)
